general_advisory: Farmers are advised to grow short duration Rabi crops like green gram, black gram, cowpea, field pea, lentil, groundnut, toria, and sunflower in medium/shallow lowlands utilizing the available soil moisture in the field. Farmers are advised to visit their crop fields regularly to check pest infestation. Use groundnut varieties suitable for Odisha conditions like Devi, Kadri-6, Kadri-9, TG-37A, TAG-51, TAG-38, and TAG-24. For managing wilt and rot disease in brinjal and tomato, drench the root zone with a solution of Plantomycin mixed in water. Various crop stage-specific advisories are mentioned for different crops.

advisory: Sow green gram in medium/shallow lowlands using available soil moisture.

Sow cowpea in medium/shallow lowlands with existing soil moisture.
Sow field pea in medium/shallow lowlands with available soil moisture.
Sow lentil in medium/shallow lowlands using soil moisture.
Use suitable groundnut varieties for Odisha conditions.
Drench the root zone with a solution to manage wilt and rot disease.
Drench the root zone with a solution to manage wilt and rot disease.
Control internode borer by management techniques.
Prepare poison bait to manage fruit fly in cucurbits.
Manage fertilizer application for optimal growth.
Spray wettable sulphur or Fenpyroximate to manage Red Spider Mites.
